intro: Senecio acromaculus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, making it a popular ornamental plant. Senecio acromaculus is relatively easy to care for, making it a favorite among indoor gardeners.
